user_stories.title: As a Test Engineer, I want to define an LLM test case with a name and description so that I can clearly identify and understand its purpose.
user_stories.description: This story focuses on allowing a Test Engineer to create a basic LLM test case definition by providing a unique name and a descriptive text. This is the foundational step for any test case creation.
acceptance_criteria: The system allows a new LLM test case to be created with a unique name.
The system allows a description to be associated with the test case.
The system stores the created test case definition persistently.
An API endpoint exists for creating a new LLM test case.

tasks.title: Design REST API endpoint for creating LLM test case
tasks.description: Define the HTTP method, URL path, request body schema (name, description), and response structure for creating a test case.

tasks.title: Implement backend service for test case creation
tasks.description: Develop the server-side logic to receive POST requests, validate input, and store the test case name and description in the database.

tasks.title: Create database schema for LLM test cases
tasks.description: Define the table structure including fields for 'id', 'name', 'description', 'created_at', and 'updated_at'.

tasks.title: Write unit tests for the test case creation API
tasks.description: Develop unit tests to ensure the API correctly handles valid and invalid input, uniqueness constraints, and proper data storage.

user_stories.title: As a Test Engineer, I want to specify input prompts and expected output patterns for an LLM test case so that I can validate the LLM's responses.
user_stories.description: This story enables the Test Engineer to define the core components of an LLM test: the input text (prompt) given to the LLM and the criteria against which its output will be evaluated (expected patterns).
acceptance_criteria: A test case can be associated with one or more input prompts.
A test case can define one or more expected output patterns (e.g., regex, keyword presence).
The system allows updating an existing test case with prompt and expected output data.
The API endpoints support defining and retrieving prompt and expected output details for a test case.

tasks.title: Extend database schema for prompts and expected outputs
tasks.description: Add tables or columns to store prompt text and expected output data (e.g., 'type', 'value') linked to a test case ID.

tasks.title: Update API endpoints to support prompt and expected output definition
tasks.description: Modify the test case creation/update endpoints to accept arrays of prompts and expected output definitions within the request body.

tasks.title: Implement data validation for prompt and output patterns
tasks.description: Add backend logic to validate the format and content of prompts and expected output patterns (e.g., valid regex).

tasks.title: Develop integration tests for prompt and output storage
tasks.description: Create tests that verify a complete test case definition, including prompts and expected outputs, can be successfully stored and retrieved.

user_stories.title: As a Junior Developer, I want updated API documentation for defining LLM test cases so that I can correctly integrate with the test management system.
user_stories.description: This story focuses on ensuring that the API endpoints developed for defining LLM test cases are well-documented, making it easy for other developers to understand and use them.
acceptance_criteria: Swagger/OpenAPI documentation is updated for all test case definition endpoints.
Each endpoint's documentation includes clear examples for requests and responses.
Parameter types, required fields, and error codes are clearly defined.
The documentation is accessible via a navigable interface.

tasks.title: Update OpenAPI specification for test case creation and update
tasks.description: Add or modify the OpenAPI definitions for the POST and PUT/PATCH endpoints related to LLM test cases.

tasks.title: Generate and verify documentation portal
tasks.description: Run the documentation generator and manually review the output to ensure accuracy and completeness.

tasks.title: Review documentation with a peer
tasks.description: Conduct a peer review of the API documentation to catch any ambiguities or errors.
